title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.10-1 | 6-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: like that for the all powerful lord unlimited lord it is very very insignificant to vanquish the radiation of the brahmastra
segments.summary: The speaker explains how the Lord easily vanquished the Brahmastra aimed at Pariksit, comparing it to the sun evaporating a dewdrop, highlighting the Lord's unlimited power.

segments.key_quote: krishna is always eternally unlimitedly powerful so therefore never compare krishna with any devatas
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes Krishna's unlimited power and warns against comparing Him to demigods, who derive their power from Krishna.

segments.key_quote: krishna's work is over he vanquished the brahmastra saved pariksit he gave him brave darshan and immediately he disappeared
segments.summary: The speaker recounts how Krishna entered Uttara's womb, saved Pariksit from the Brahmastra, and then disappeared after giving darshan.

themes: Difference between Lord and Living Beings
segments.key_quote: This one difference, if you remember, immediately we can understand the difference between the Supreme Lord Krishna and every other living being, in whatever position, whatever situation, whatever power, whatever position, no living being can compare with the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the difference between the Supreme Lord and individual living beings, refuting the Mayavadi philosophy that equates all living beings with God, emphasizing the Lord's unlimited nature.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is in your body, my body, everyone's body, everybody. That's the difference between Krishna and each one of us.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the concept of all-pervasiveness, contrasting the limited consciousness of individual souls within their bodies with Krishna's unlimited consciousness that pervades everything.

segments.key_quote: Because he is all-pervasive, unlimited by time and space, he can appear even within the womb of the mother of child Parikshit.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna's all-pervasiveness allows Him to appear anywhere, unlike limited living beings, and that He protects those who are surrendered to Him.

segments.key_quote: The Lord is the indirect protector of the unrighteous also.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the Lord indirectly protects the unrighteous by rectifying their sins through His external energy, and describes the Lord as being dressed in all ten directions, signifying His presence everywhere.

segments.key_quote: So when Krishna appears, he becomes visible to us right in that place where he appears. And when he disappears, he becomes invisible.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that Krishna's disappearance doesn't mean He leaves, but rather becomes invisible, and that He is present everywhere, but can only be seen when He gives darshan.
